title: Study of P-wave Feshbach Molecules
text: Advanced study of ultracold atomic physics including cooling mechanisms, Feshbach resonances, and P-wave contacts. This research is directly relevant to current quantum computing and quantum simulation applications.

title: Solving 1D and 2D Time-Dependent Schrödinger Equation
text: Applied finite difference method to study eigenvalues and time evolution of eigenvectors from 1D and 2D time-dependent Schrödinger equation for arbitrary potential energy functions.

title: Electromagnetically Induced Transparency via Coupled Oscillators
text: Reproduced EIT-like behavior by solving coupled simple harmonic oscillator systems using numerical methods and different ODE solvers to analyze oscillator dynamics.

title: Monte Carlo Simulation of 2D Ising Model
text: Investigated physical properties of different sizes of 2D binary alloys using Monte Carlo methods to study phase transitions and critical phenomena in statistical mechanics.

title: 3D Time-Independent Schrödinger Equation Solver
text: Developed finite difference method to find eigenvalues and eigenvectors from the 3D time-independent Schrödinger equation for arbitrary potential energy functions.

title: 2D Time-Independent Schrödinger Equation Solver
text: Applied finite difference method to solve 2D time-independent Schrödinger equation for arbitrary potential energy functions, extending 1D numerical approaches.

title: 1D Time-Independent Schrödinger Equation Solver
text: Implemented tri-diagonal method to find eigenvalues and eigenvectors from the bounded 1D time-independent Schrödinger equation for arbitrary potential energy functions.

title: Topological Photonics
text: Investigated topology in physics using 1D diatomic crystal structures, Berry phase in quantum models, and Integer Quantum Hall effects under supervision of Prof. Daniel H.C. Ong.

title: Computing Band Structures
text: Computational study of electronic band structures for different materials using Quantum ESPRESSO based on density functional theory under supervision of Prof. HUI Pak Ming.

title: Classical Analog of Electromagnetically Induced Transparency
text: Reproduced EIT-like behavior using coupled RLC circuits, demonstrating classical analogies to quantum optical phenomena under supervision of Prof. Daniel H.C. Ong.

title: CHSH Inequality and Wave-Particle Duality
text: Experimental verification using entangled photon pairs and quED/quCR demonstrator to study quantum entanglement, Bell's theorem, and local hidden variable theories under supervision of Prof. Sai Tak CHU.

title: NP-complete Problems in Combinatorial Optimization
text: Applied genetic algorithms and self-organizing mapping to solve NP-hard problems, specifically the traveling salesman problem, demonstrating computational physics approaches to optimization.
